title: 112_hr4265
content: The Act is titled the "Shared Responsibility in Preserving America's Future Act" and includes a surtax on millionaires contingent on the passage of a balanced budget amendment or spending limit amendment. This surtax is added as a new part to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. For taxable years between 2012 and 2023, non-corporate taxpayers are subject to a 5% tax on modified adjusted gross income exceeding $1,000,000, with adjustments for inflation starting from 2013. For taxable years between 2012 and 2023, non-corporate taxpayers are subject to a 5% tax on modified adjusted gross income exceeding $1,000,000, with adjustments for inflation. The threshold amount for married individuals filing separately is one-half of the amount for the taxable year. Modified adjusted gross income is calculated by reducing adjusted gross income by the excess of gross income from a trade or business that is not a passive activity and for which the taxpayer pays wages to at least 1 full-time equivalent employee. The section defines income for employees, excluding the taxpayer, and regulations for determining such income. Special rules apply to nonresident aliens and citizens/residents living abroad, adjusting the dollar amount based on exclusions and deductions. The section outlines rules for income exclusions and deductions, including disallowed deductions under section 911(d)(6) and exceptions for charitable trusts. The tax imposed is not considered for certain credits or purposes under this chapter. Application of the section is contingent on a balanced budget or spending limit amendment. Application of the section is contingent on a balanced budget or spending limit amendment. If the certification is not made by the President before September 30, 2012, this section shall not apply to any taxable year. Ratification must occur before December 31, 2017, for this section to apply to taxable years after that date. A clerical amendment is made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment in subsection (a) regarding the surtax on millionaires will not change the tax rate under section 15 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. These amendments will be effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2012.
